TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit Win32Exception extends System.Runtime.InteropServices.ExternalException implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Docs.summary: Throws an exception for a Win32 error code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Win32 error codes are translated from their numeric representations into a system message when they are displayed. Use <xref:System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception.NativeErrorCode%2A> to access the numeric representation of the error code associated with this exception. For more information about the error codes, see "Win32 Error Codes" in the Platform SDK documentation at [http://msdn.microsoft.com](http://msdn.microsoft.com/).
## Examples The following code example shows how to catch a Win32 exception and interpret its content. The example attempts to start a nonexistent executable, which results in a Win32 exception. Upon catching the exception, the example fetches the respective error message, code, and origin of the exception.
[!code-cpp[Win32Exception#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.componentmodel._36_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[Win32Exception#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.componentmodel._36_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Win32Exception#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.componentmodel._36_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the last Win32 error that occurred.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The detailed description of the error will be determined by the Win32 error message associated with the error.
This constructor uses the <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal.GetLastWin32Error%2A> method of <xref:System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal> to get its error code.

Docs.permission: for access to unmanaged code. Associated enumeration:

Docs.param: The Win32 error code associated with this exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified error.
